channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: ⁦@kampeas⁩ in top form with this obit. https://t.co/buljOVkOkL

item.description: @TheRaDR Luna was not expecting that answer. But she appreciates the inter species solidarity. https://t.co/uztyNuimmA

item.description: @titanicbluebird @joshtpm @neal_katyal @franklinleonard Yes. “Trump’s Razor” — always the stupidest possible explanation.
item.source:markdown: @titanicbluebird @joshtpm @neal_katyal @franklinleonard Yes. “Trump’s Razor” — always the stupidest possible explanation.

item.description: So my impulse buy of @BarSiegal’s new book arrived. I hope to be able to post reactions to at least the first few pages after Shabbos. But let me note that at 220 pages and a 5.5x8.5 trim size, it’s perfect for stashing in a tallis bag. https://t.co/7oDASJzlww
item.source:markdown: So my impulse buy of @BarSiegal’s new book arrived. I hope to be able to post reactions to at least the first few pages after Shabbos. But let me note that at 220 pages and a 5.5x8.5 trim size, it’s perfect for stashing in a tallis bag. https://t.co/7oDASJzlww

item.description: @isaiah_bb מזל טוב!
item.source:markdown: @isaiah_bb מזל טוב!

item.description: @HayimBrody In my experience, separating the “no more Kaddish” from “first yahrzeit” works nicely.
item.source:markdown: @HayimBrody In my experience, separating the “no more Kaddish” from “first yahrzeit” works nicely.

item.description: @trekonomics Really, it reflects a rampant failure of the “teach everyone to code” movement. Hard to believe so many people willing to entrust their money to enterprises premised on bug-free “smart contract” algorithms.
item.source:markdown: @trekonomics Really, it reflects a rampant failure of the “teach everyone to code” movement. Hard to believe so many people willing to entrust their money to enterprises premised on bug-free “smart contract” algorithms.

item.description: @stacyfmitchell Worth noting that Ingram's Lightning Source print-on-demand service just upped its minimum discount from 20% to 30%, presumably under pressure from Amazon. So that's another 10% of the list price of @benyehudapress titles going straight into Jeff Bezos' pocket.
item.source:markdown: @stacyfmitchell Worth noting that Ingram's Lightning Source print-on-demand service just upped its minimum discount from 20% to 30%, presumably under pressure from Amazon. So that's another 10% of the list price of @benyehudapress titles going straight into Jeff Bezos' pocket.

item.description: @RokhlK That’s part of being stupid. Or suffering from oppositional defiance disorder.
item.source:markdown: @RokhlK That’s part of being stupid. Or suffering from oppositional defiance disorder.

item.description: @EladNehorai I asked AI to show me "that time the Lubavitcher rebbe and Rav Soloveitchik met up in Monica's apartment in an episode of Friends." This is what I got. https://t.co/U9IlzKnJQa

item.description: @trekonomics As a Turkish person with more than a touch of New Jersey, Dr Oz would like to remind you of the old Ottoman proverb: Revenge is a dish best served very cold. And with guacamole and tequila.
item.source:markdown: @trekonomics As a Turkish person with more than a touch of New Jersey, Dr Oz would like to remind you of the old Ottoman proverb: Revenge is a dish best served very cold. And with guacamole and tequila.

item.description: And Republicans dis New Jersey once again. https://t.co/4ecVPDzzbB

item.description: @joshtpm The good news is that the Democratic mayor of Cliffside Park is up for re-election in 2023, so if the Senate doesn't work out, he can try hometown politics instead.
item.source:markdown: @joshtpm The good news is that the Democratic mayor of Cliffside Park is up for re-election in 2023, so if the Senate doesn't work out, he can try hometown politics instead.

item.description: @MTakeshisan @cstross Advice for your future self: I recently confirmed that the book holds up on rereading after 15 years or so.
item.source:markdown: @MTakeshisan @cstross Advice for your future self: I recently confirmed that the book holds up on rereading after 15 years or so.

item.description:
@datadivajf I’m sorry, but this one strained my willing disbelief because of one central, inescapable flaw: That’s not how science fiction magazines worked.

@datadivajf Stories were written by freelancers.

@datadivajf As was, of course, TOS.
@RokhlK Wait. You can experience real sloths on Long Island now?
item.source:markdown: @RokhlK Wait. You can experience real sloths on Long Island now?
